title: Students share photos of their teachers' VERY funny and inventive approaches to lessons
text:
Every teacher knows it can be difficult to keep students focused in class, so some have come up with amusing ways to ensure the attention is always on them.

The photos, which vary from witty classroom signs to inventive pranks, have been taken from pupils around the world and collated in an online gallery by Bored Panda.

One photo shows a teacher writing movie spoilers on his white board until his class behave, while another depicts a class receiving a 'Shakespeare insult kit' to make their English lessons more enjoyable.

Here, FEMAIL shares some of the most creative and humorous examples from the bunch...

No-nonsense approach! An unidentified teacher in an undisclosed location writes movie spoilers on his white board until his class behaves

Telling it straight! A pupil captures a science teacher during their school's 'Meme Day', who wants to be convinced that rhinos aren't just out of shape unicorns. It is unclear where the image was taken

A helping hand! A class, in an unknown location, is given a 'Shakespeare insult kit' to make their English lessons more enjoyable

Caught out! Students saw the funny side of this teacher's T-shirt, which expected only some classmates to guess the second point from the content given

Out of office! A teacher pranks his students by placing a picture of inside his work study onto his door. The location of the school is not identified

Joke of the day! Wanting to start the day off right, this unidentified teacher writes memes and jokes every morning for his class to read

What a joker! Instead of taking attendance, a teacher asks his students to point out which picture out of four is him during a mid-term exam. It is unclear where this image was taken

Now that's commitment! This unidentified college professor has been dressing up as Papa Smurf for Halloween for the last five years during classes

Deep thought! This teacher wants to point out the struggle of dealing with 'stupid' people. It is unclear where the snap was taken

Looking good! This teacher proves he's neither boring nor straight-laced with a funky tie, showing a cat wearing a matching garment

Real-life art! An art teacher, from the US, shows off his fun side with an amazing Van Gogh-inspired costume
description: Pupils from around the world have shared photos of their teachers' funny and inventive approaches to lessons. The amusing snaps have been collated in an online gallery by Bored Panda.
